Description: Painted wooden shabti of Tameret (?), Chantress of Amun with a black painted lappet-wig, a red modelled face with traced black eyes, a red collar, crossed red hands holding two red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with red representations of a yoke with nw-pots, a seed-basket and bandaging.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (perhaps)
